thread.title: Dubai names exec to run Museum of the Future
thread.title_full: Dubai names exec to run Museum of the Future

title: Dubai names exec to run Museum of the Future
text:
Dubai names exec to run Museum of the Future Article By Staff Writer Friday, 11 September 2015 9:29 AM 
Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Crown Prince of Dubai, has issued a resolution appointing Saif Abdullah Al Aulaili as CEO of the Dubai Foundation for the Museum of the Future. 
Prior to the new appointment, Al Aulaili held several positions in government and has been serving in the Prime Minister’s Office since 2014. 
The non-profit research institution, which is dedicated to science and the future of innovation and exploring the next generation of technology, will be responsible for running the Museum of the Future, a project announced earlier year. 
The circular building will house some of the world’s latest inventions and will be located next to the Jumeirah Emirates Towers near Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC). 
The foundation serves as an international platform for developing scientific and innovative solutions to address the developmental challenges of cities of the future. 
It also aims to increase social awareness on the importance of innovation and contribute to encouraging inventors locally, regionally and internationally. 
According to news agency WAM, Sheikh Hamdan’s decision reflects his support for the development of national talent and the recruitment of young Emiratis in key positions. 
Al Aulaili has previously supervised several strategic initiatives and is part of the organising committee of the Government Summit and a senior coordinator of UAE Drones for Good Award.
